unit_learning_outcomes.description: Implement a range of pedagogical models including ICT to teach historical knowledge, understanding and skills.
Develop logical and sequential lessons and teaching and learning materials to meet learning outcomes.
Demonstrate understanding and application of the NSW Education Standards Authority (NESA) assessment requirements.
Demonstrate effective communication strategies to engage learners including listening and questioning strategies.
Demonstrate understanding and application of the knowledge base underpinning the principles and practices of teaching and learning history.
Design assessment strategies that demonstrate the achievement of outcomes.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Workshop preparation may include completing set readings, conducting research, or, compiling resources

enrolment_rules.description: ((TEP401 or EDTE4010(S)) and (TEP427 or EDTE4270)) or (EDST3010 and EDTE4270)

assessments.description: Students design a teaching resource for either an Ancient History OR Modern History class, selecting one option from a set of three (options change with each offering). (2,500 words)

assessments.assessment_title: Historiographical essay, annotated sources and pedagogical reflection
assessments.description: Students are required to investigate an area of changing historical interpretation and produce a historiographical essay and annotated sources, together with a pedagogical reflection on the role of historiographical understanding in the teaching of history. (3,500 words)

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: EDTE4280 - History in the Secondary School II
data.description: This unit focusses on the NSW Stage 6 History syllabi. It concentrates on consolidating and refining students' programming, lesson planning and pedagogical strategies appropriate for teaching senior secondary school students. The unit provides an in-depth analysis of current trends in teaching Ancient History, History Extension and Modern History and looks more closely at the senior syllabi, standards-based assessment and the requirements of the HSC. The unit focuses on developing students' competence, confidence and professionalism in teaching History in the secondary school.
